stem: The nurse reviews the clinical data from 0800 to 1100. Which finding most clearly indicates a therapeutic response to the interventions?

options.text: Increased heart rate from 110 bpm to 125 bpm.
Blood pressure increase from 140/90 mmHg to 160/100 mmHg.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
0800: Patient admitted for alcohol withdrawal. CIWA initiated. Reports mild anxiety.
0900: Administered lorazepam 2mg IV. Patient resting quietly.
1000: Patient denies hallucinations. Continues to rest.
1100: Patient alert and oriented. States feeling calmer.

tabs.title: Orders
tabs.content: Lorazepam 2mg IV q4h PRN for CIWA > 8. Monitor vital signs and CIWA score q1h.

rationale.correctRationale: A decreased CIWA score indicates a reduction in the severity of alcohol withdrawal symptoms, demonstrating a positive response to the interventions. A CIWA score decreasing from 18 to 12 over the course of three hours is a clear clinical improvement.
incorrectRationales: An increased heart rate is indicative of worsening withdrawal or inadequate treatment.
Increased auditory hallucinations indicate a worsening of the withdrawal state and a lack of therapeutic effect.
An increase in blood pressure suggests that the patient's withdrawal symptoms are not being adequately controlled.
clinicalPearls: CIWA scores are used to assess the severity of alcohol withdrawal and guide treatment decisions.
A decrease in CIWA score indicates a positive response to interventions, while an increase indicates worsening withdrawal.
Vital signs, particularly heart rate and blood pressure, are important indicators of alcohol withdrawal severity.
rationale.questionTrap: Students may select increasing vital signs, misinterpreting them as a sign of the body 'recovering' when actually the opposite is true. The key is to look for a DECREASE in the CIWA score showing improvement.
rationale.mnemonic: CIWA-Ar stands for Clinical Institute Withdrawal Assessment for Alcohol-Revised. Remember: Lower is better!
